content.Appearance:
Main article: Stocking/Gallery

[ -Stocking in "Excretion Without Honor and Humanity
".
-Stocking in "Bitch Girls 4 Life
". ]
1/2

Stocking is of moderate height and buxom figure compared to Panty's slightly slimmer figure. She has pale skin and long dark-blue hair with a pink underside and reaching knee length styled in a hime-cut and some pink stripes on the bangs, and has a blue bow adorned at the back of her hair. She has teal eyes with prominent, triangular lower eyelashes, and she always carries an apathetic, deadpan expression on her face.
content.Appearance--Outfit--Human form:
Stocking dresses in a dark-colored, gothic Lolita style. In her human form, she wears a black short dress with puffy sleeves and a white laced underside underneath the dress, she wears a white collared blouse with a blue western bow-tie, along with a large blue bow which is tied backwards around her waist. She wears blue-black stripped stockings and a pair of black loafers.

In season two , Stocking's appearance is slightly altered. Her hair has a gradient which fades from pink to purple. The color of the bottom stripes of Stocking's hair were also changed from pink to purple and her blue to a bluish indigo.
content.Appearance--Outfit--Angel form (former):
In her angel form, she wears a white dress with baby blue horizontal stripes, featuring a layered, ruffled skirt trimmed with lace that gives it a soft, floaty look. The bodice has a corset-like design made of silver metallic fabric, detailed with light blue frill trim, and a white bow is tied at the back.

A blue heart sits at the centre of her chest, surrounded by two silver straps that cross over her shoulders. A silver strap is wrapped around her upper chest, and her waist is adorned with two more blue hearts, each accented with ribbon bows.

Beneath the dress, she wears blue-and-white striped stockings, cut at the bottom like leg warmers. Her footwear consists of silver open-toed high heels with silver cross-shaped straps across the top of the foot. At the back of her head, she wears her usual blue bow, along with a silver choker decorated with light blue frills.

On each wrist, she wears two silver bracelets, and long white sleeves extend from silver rings on her middle fingers to silver armbands resting on her upper arms. Like Panty, she has small, white cherub wings on her back.
content.Appearance--Outfit--Angel form (current):
In her new angel form, she wears a frilly, cropped white blouse with puffed sleeves and a heart-shaped chest cutout, accented with bright blue heart motifs and delicate frills. A short, layered frilly skirt with two blue heart bows and long trailing ribbons at the waist is secured by a silver belt-like strap. She wears blue-and-white striped thigh-high stockings styled like a garter belt, each adorned with a heart, and silver open-toed high heels with cross-shaped straps and small wings at the ankles.

Accessories include a silver Civic Crown headband with a blue heart gem and her usual bow, a silver frilled choker, and gloves with frills extending from the middle rings, connected behind her back to a blue heart gem with cascading ribbons. Large white angel wings complete the playful, striking look, unified by the recurring blue heart motifs.
content.Personality:
Stocking happily eating roll cake in " The Diet Syndrome ".

Stocking's defining trait is her love for sweet food. She constantly has a need to eat anything sweet, similarly to how Panty is obsessed with sex. Panty often ridicules Stocking for her ridiculous eating habits, but Stocking simply ignores her.

Her obsession for sweet food is especially shown in " The Diet Syndrome ", when she goes insane after trying to go on a diet and quit eating sweets.

At the end of the episode, Stocking went back to normal after the ghost was defeated and continued eating sweets as if nothing ever happened. Although, it seems that Stocking has calmed her urges, as she stated she was on a diet in " Independence Dick ". Stocking hates spicy food just as much as Panty hates sweet food.

Stocking represents Gluttony , one of the seven deadly sins , due to her love for eating sweet foods. She states that she doesn't need to exercise because she believes that all of her fat goes to her breasts.

Stocking would much rather stay at home eating sweets, but unlike Panty and her sex obsession, Stocking doesn't let her love for sweets get in the way of her Ghost-hunting duties, which is why she is let back into Heaven.

Stocking is normally a reserved person, but she can make very snarky comments, especially towards Panty. Stocking also possesses a cynical, cold and sardonic demeanor, and because of this, she isn't as popular as Panty, although many people (including women) find Stocking to be attractive.

Between the Anarchy Sisters, Stocking is the more intelligent of the two (something that even Panty admits in " Nothing to Room "), although she is still not completely smart.

In " High School Nudical ", she and Panty didn't realize that Master G was Garterbelt , and in " The Stripping ", she and Panty also didn't realize that the dealer was Kneesocks . While skeptical at first, she, too, fell victim to the trend of nose-picking in " Raiders of the Nasal Dark ".

Stocking sobbing in " The Ohagi of Doom ".

Despite her normally reserved personality, Stocking is the most emotional of the four girls because she tends to cry when she is overwhelmingly upset. Examples of this are when she becomes too impatient for Garterbelt's upcoming dinner and lashes out at Chuck in " Nothing to Room ", when she talks to Scanty about how Panty has mistreated her because of her younger age in " Project S: The Worst Ever Dojo ", when the owner of Diamond Head died in " The Silence of the Internets ", and when Gunsmith Bitch ate her Ohagi Unicorn for which she had been craving in " The Ohagi of Doom ". This tendency may imply that Stocking is the youngest of the four girls.

While Stocking disapproves of Panty's obsession with sex, she is also shown to have sexual desires, especially that of masochism and BDSM . In " Catfight Club " and " If the Angels Wore Swimsuits ", Stocking is shown getting pleasure out of being entangled, and in " 1 Angry Ghost ", Stocking ejaculates after being electrocuted repeatedly. In " Trans-homers ", it is also revealed that Stocking owns a dildo. Stocking also gains immense sexual pleasure, which she says feels better than sex, every time someone likes her Influenstagram posts in " Bitch Perfect ".

Stocking says that she has special standards in men and would rather seek for a long-term relationship rather than a one-night stand. Stocking has a very unusual and strange vision of what being attractive is, as seen in " Ghost: The Phantom of Daten City ", when she decided against having sex with handsome men and instead fell in love with a gross and utterly shameless ghost.

There are also rare instances where Stocking is implied to be unchaste, such as in " Nothing to Room ", when Panty talks about a man who made out with Stocking the night prior. Stocking says she nearly let him have sex with her, but didn't because she wanted to avoid seeming slutty. She also says that she had sex with one of Panty's muscular friends in " Catfight Club ", though she may have just been trying to provoke Panty.

In the Manga Strip series, Stocking is just as lewd as Panty, having sex with several men and women.

Stocking lovingly hugging Vibe in " Pet Cematary Hills ".

Stocking is prone to finding small creatures very cute. In " Pulp Addiction ", she instantly adored the Cowpers and even asked Panty if she could adopt one, despite them being evil ghosts.

She also became enamored with Vibe in " Pet Cematary Hills " and yelled at Panty for trying to kill her. In " Mutant Garterbelts ", Stocking found the baby turtle ghosts to be cute and directed the ghosts towards the sea with the help of Panty.

Being a goth girl, Stocking takes interest in macabre and gothic aesthetics. Stocking has plushies of Jack Skellington and Oogie Boogie (both from The Nightmare Before Christmas ), Death Jr. (from the eponymous video game ), Lenore (from Lenore, the Cute Little Dead Girl ), Frankenweenie (from the eponymous film ), and Anabelle (from Nightmares and Fairy Tales ). In " Bitch Perfect ", Stocking dressed up as Wednesday Addams for one of her Influenstagram posts. In " Nothing to Room ", Stocking says that she was on the verge of writing poetry and even cutting herself because of how hungry she had gotten.
content.Background--Description:
Taken from NewPSG.com:

"The younger sister, banished to Earth along with her sister Panty. A goth girl with straight bangs and ultra-long hair. She fights by transforming her worn stockings into two katana-shaped heavenly weapons, ＜ Stripe I & II ＞."

Stocking and her twin sister, Panty , are angels who were kicked out of Heaven for their immoral behavior; for Stocking, it was likely due to her gluttonous behavior and somewhat cynical personality. They were both sent to live at a church with Garterbelt in Daten City , a city on Earth, in order to kill ghosts . Once they earned enough Heaven Coins from the ghosts they killed, they would be able to return to Heaven. Stocking battles ghosts by transforming her stockings into katanas, named Stripes I & II .

In " Bitch Girls: 2 Bitch ", Stocking kills Panty and cuts her into 666 pieces, revealing that she was a demon the whole time. The next episode, " Panty and Stocking: Homecoming ", shows that Corset had simply brainwashed her into thinking she was a demon.

Corset attempts to ensure that Stocking would stay evil by spawning multiple micro-Corsets, which whispered malicious thoughts in her ear. However, this backfires on Corset, as Stocking transforms into a massive ghost named Super-Sized Bitch.

Stocking as "Sister Stockiel".

In the midst of Panty and Stocking's fierce brawl, Stocking reverts back to normal. Beginning with " Bitch Girls 4 Life ", she and Panty are forced to work with Scanty and Kneesocks to kill ghosts.

At the end of "Heaven Wars Episode Three: Revenge Of The Bitch" , Stocking replaces Garterbelt's role as the priestess for Junior and Bastard , after Garterbelt passed away of a heart attack.

Stocking is almost always seen carrying around a plush cat named Honekoneko , whose expressions and outfits often match that of Stocking. She loves Honekoneko dearly and won't let anyone else touch it.
content.Background--Fame:
Stocking's Influenstagram page.

Stocking is a popular celebrity on Earth; however, she is usually overshadowed by Panty in public because of her promiscuous personality. This is shown in " Sex and the Daten City ", when the crowd gave Stocking a subdued applause when she introduced herself at the Daten Theatre , as opposed to Panty, who received a lively round of applause.

Despite this, Stocking has a large presence on the Internet, as she owns a blog and posts on social media websites such as YouTobe and Influenstagram . She is shown to have over 536,000 followers on Influenstagram.
content.Background--Criminal Record:
Stocking's mugshot in " Longest Bitch Yard ".

Stocking has been arrested in " 1 Angry Ghost " and " Longest Bitch Yard ". Even though Stocking isn't as problematic as her older sister Panty she did have some crimes on her rap sheet.

[ -Animal abuse
 - Stocking has stomped on, strangled, stabbed, kicked, and thrown Chuck
 countless times throughout the series.
-Battery
 - Stocking has fought with Panty (though these were just petty squabbles) and punched Brief numerous times. She also fought with Kneesocks in "Longest Bitch Yard
", though Kneesocks kicked her in the head first. During a riot in "HELP! We are Angels
", Stocking bashed a fan right in the head with her guitar for climbing on the stage. In "Shoot for Yesterday!
", Stocking punched Baywatcher
, causing him to crash into a nurse's apartment and temporarily lose his memory.
-Extortion
 - In "Daten City President
", Stocking threatened to kill the President of Business
 unless he dropped out of the election. However, this can be excused because the president was a ghost.
-Frame-up
 - In "Bitch Girls 4 Life
", Stocking, along with Panty, Scanty, Kneesocks, and Garterbelt, solely blamed Brief for the fire that caused Pancake Guy
 to explode, even though Panty was largely responsible.
-Hit and run
 - In "Catfight Club
", Stocking ran over Brief and two other boys. In "Mutant Garterbelts
", Stocking ran over Brief again.
-Murder
 - Stocking has murdered many ghosts in the series, though these can be considered self-defense because the ghosts intended to harm her and others. In "1 Angry Ghost
", she and Panty were put on trial for supposedly murdering an innocent ghost
, though they were acquitted after it was later discovered that the ghost's wife
 was actually responsible. In "Bitch Girls: 2 Bitch
", Stocking murdered Panty, though she only did this because she was brainwashed by Corset, which may count as coercion.
-Red light violation
 - This is one of Stocking's charges for her arrest in "Longest Bitch Yard
".
-Vandalism
 - In "The Stripping
", Panty and Stocking painted themselves on a man's car without his consent. ]

" that she is over 500 years old.
 [ -However, as revealed in the Neverending Streaming
 covering the episode "Independence Dick
", the Poly Brothers (this also extending to their cousins, Panty and Stocking, as well as to Scanty and Kneesocks) are "around Brief's age" because they "wanted to give him similarly-aged friends". ]
-Stocking was originally set to have a much flatter chest and wear a tie.
-Given how Drawn Together
 was stated to be one of the biggest inspirations for the show, particularly it's vulgarity, it may be possible that Stocking’s character was inspired by the character of Toot Braunstein. Both are gluttonous and are often depicted as the “punching bag” of fat jokes. They also wear black and white dresses and have an “old school” type of style. Toot being a parody of the rubber-hose era of animation and Stocking being a gothic Lolita as Lolita fashion is based on Victorian clothing. Stocking is also meant to be the “cuter” one of the sisters and Toot is meant to be a bit of a “cute but psycho” type of character. Although Toot is seen as frequently “ugly” and Stocking much less frequently so.
 [ -While it certainly just could be there to add to her gothic and Lolita look (or doubly add so), Stocking is the only main character to have vertical, doll-like, short more stylized eyelashes while the other main girls have horizontal and less stylized eyelashes. This specific design choice could have potentially been inspired by Toot’s own appearance. ]
-In "Death Race 2010
", Panty and Stocking's surname is revealed to be Anarchy, befitting the sisters, "anarchy" means "a state of disorder due to absence or nonrecognition of authority or other controlling systems."
-According to the creators, Stocking is meant to be “the perfect mix of Gothic Lolita and Sweet Lolita”. Although, most people just focus on her being gothic. ]

Panty and Stocking in Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann

[ -Panty and Stocking make a cameo in the manga, Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann
.
-In the chapter, "Killing Me Hard
", it is revealed that Panty and Stocking are atheists.
-There is a scene in "High School Nudical
" in which Stocking slaps several girls' breasts similarly to how Panty was slapping several boys' penises, implying that Stocking may be bisexual.
 [ -In the Manga Strip
 series, Stocking has sex with various male and female characters in different chapters, including her own sister, Panty. However, it is unknown if the Manga Strip
 series is canon to the anime. Unlike their rivals, Scanty and Kneesocks, the Anarchy sisters do not have any sort of incestuous relationship in the anime. ]
-The girls seen in the music video for TeddyLoid
's 2014 song, "ME!ME!ME!", have designs that are based off of Stocking. TeddyLoid was also the main producer for the Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt
 soundtrack
 albums
.
-In the Ben 10: Omniverse
 episode, "Mystery, Incorporeal", one of Darkstar's cultists resembles Stocking.
-The color palette of Windblade in Transformers: Shattered Glass
 is a reference to Stocking. This was likely done as a response to "Trans-homers
", which has lots of references to the Transformers
 franchise. ]

Kino (Dengeki Bunko 2007 Movie Festival.name: Toaru Kagaku no Railgun S Episode 19

content.Synopsis:
Febrie shows no fondness for Mikoto.

With the help of Saten's knowledge on how to deal with young children, the girls listen with surprise as the girl named Febrie introduces herself and mentions the name Misaka Mikoto. Saten others wonder if Mikoto knows the girl, to which Mikoto denies. After punishing Kuroko for suggesting that the girl is her daughter, Mikoto decides to introduce herself to Febrie. However, the shy girl quickly goes to Saten's side as if cautious of the girl who is just talking to her.

Mikoto refuses to admit defeat over a young girl, so she uses her rare pink Gekota and a hairclip to charm Febrie by making it dance using her ability. It did work, but Mikoto is shocked as Febrie quickly snatches her pink Gekota and runs away, although Kuroko easily brings her back. A disgruntled Mikoto scolds Febrie for "stealing" her Gekota toy, and Febrie instinctively returns to Saten's side; unfortunately, even Saten, who may already had the little girl's trust, was unable to persuade Febrie to return the Gekota toy to Mikoto.

Night soon falls, and Uiharu and Kuroko decide to contact Judgment for any information about a lost child that matches Febrie's description. To their disappointment, there are no reports of missing persons that match Febrie, and Anti-Skill cannot be contacted at that time. Saten then decides to take care of the then sleeping Febrie for the meantime, putting her experience over younger siblings to good use, although she also decided to ask some assistance from Uiharu as well.

[ -Mikoto tries to entertain Febrie through Gekota.
-The girls prepare to eat dinner.
-This "Come hither" look shall soon be judged.
-...And was convicted.
-Febrie falls into the world of dreams.
-The lollipop is apparently an acquired taste.
-No clue regarding Febrie. ]
1/7

That night, Febrie gets to stay at Uiharu's place. For a moment, she remembers her friend and former roommate Haruue Erii who just left to take care of her long-lost friend Edasaki Banri, but now, Erii's spot in the bedroom is now reserved for the young girl they found earlier. As Febrie munches onto another lollipop, Uiharu and Saten assume that she is hungry, so they prepare dinner for the night, consisting of rice, meatballs, mixed vegetables and some noodles, all of which Febrie accepted heartily. Afterwards, Saten and Febrie enjoy a nice bath together while Uiharu checks up on Febrie's belongings. For a moment, Uiharu notices that her bag is filled with lollipops, and that her dress has its tag ripped away. Soon, she joins the two inside the bathroom.

Meanwhile, over at the Tokiwadai Middle School Dormitory, Mikoto laments at the fact that Febrie took a member of her Gekota collection. Kuroko, however, does not see the reason to be exasperated over losing a children's toy, much to Mikoto's chagrin. Mikoto then remembers how Febrie was familiar of her name and wonders about how she learned of her name and the reason why she is scared of her. Kuroko is utterly shocked at discovering Mikoto's interest in children and decides to act like one for Mikoto's sake, but it spectacularly backfires when it awarded her with an electric shock.

As a charred Kuroko twitches on her bed, Mikoto continues thinking about how Febrie found out about her name.

At the Uiharu Residence, Saten almost dozes off while trying to read a bedtime story for Febrie as she sleeps. She did manage to wake herself up, though. Uiharu then joins her, commenting on how Febrie seemed like an oddball. Then, as Saten gazes at Febrie's cute sleeping face, she gains the curiosity to try out Febrie's lollipop.

Her response, as do Uiharu, Mii, Kuroko and Mikoto's, describes the lollipop's flavor as "intense", to say the least.

Uiharu and Saten take Febrie to 177th Branch of Judgment and Uiharu and continues to look for any information regarding Febrie. Even after adding Febrie to the missing persons list, there has been no immediate responses, causing Kuroko to suspect that Febrie may be a Child Error.

Soon, Erii shows up in the Judgment office after finishing preparations with her new apartment unit. The other girls soon fill her up on Febrie's current situation, and Erii shows her concern about her next place to call home, as she is anxious that not all facilities may treat her nicely as they hoped. Fortunately, Mikoto was able to ask permission fom the Tokiwadai Dormitory Supervisor to take Febrie into Asunaro Park, but the dormitory supervisor tells then that it would take five days to prepare the necessary papers for the transfer. Saten and the girls show their determination in taking care of Febrie during those five days, and Febrie is happy to hear about it, although she continues to ignore Mikoto, much to her despair.

Kuroko soon reminds Uiharu about the security meeting they need to attend for the upcoming Academic Assembly and the girls soon part ways with Erii, who was greeted with joy by Febrie, putting even more salt on the lonely Mikoto's wounds.

As Mii, Kuroko and Uiharu take the girls and Febrie to the venue for the security meeting, Mikoto vows to herself that she will make Febrie say her name before the end of the next five days.

The girls are not the only one looking for Febrie.

The girls arrive at one of the participating facilities for the Academic Assembly, and Saten notices that it was empty, far from what she was expecting from a widespread event in Academy City. Mii explains that it is unsurprising for someone like Saten to have this kind of impression of the Academic Assembly because it was designed for research and development instead of celebrations and having fun.

[ -The Dorm supervisor agrees to the girls' suggestion.
-Febrie enjoying the scenery.
-Mikoto determined to have Febrie to like her.
-Kongou blushes at being praised.
-Kongou asks Febrie to be her friend.
-The die is cast... Saten enacts her plan to have them bond.
-Aiho sights a curious delivery.
-Mikoto aside glances at the worst possible time.
-An old face appears.
-Febrie however is not too keen of what she discovers.
-Febrie realizes she's alone.
-Mikoto contacts Saten.
-A wide-eyed teary Febrie sees Mikoto.
-Febrie terrorized by loud security robots.
-No match for the Railgun.
-Febrie in the arms of Saten.
-Febrie hugs Mikoto.
-...Only to steal her finger toy away from her again. ]
1/18

Soon, Kongou Mitsuko, along with Awatsuki Maaya and Wannai Kinuho show up, much to Kuroko's shock. As Maaya introduces herself to Febrie, Kongou and Kinuho explain that a senior has asked for their help for the Academic Assembly, a favor Kongou quickly volunteers for. Soon, Maaya tells Kongou and Kinuho that Febrie has agreed to be friends with her, much to Mikoto's threefold despair. The three then leave shortly. Kuroko and Uiharu decide to attend the security meeting, leaving Mikoto and Saten to handle Febrie for the rest of the day. Mikoto takes this as a chance to try to win over Febrie's heart, but Saten seems to have foreseen this, so she decides to leave with Uiharu under the excuse of going to the washroom.

Nearby, a puzzled Yomikawa Aiho checks up on the security perimeter and laments over the large area she has to cover when two students, both operatives of Judgment, are about to receive some supplies for the upcoming event but are unauthorized to do so. As Aiho looks at some documents about the students of the school they are currently assigned at, she discovers that the school is known for their achievements in the Academic Assembly, although students of this school never show up in other venues. Soon, one of the Judgment operatives notices a man walking from a distance, although the girl was barely able to determine the identity of the unknown person.

That man was contacting someone on his phone, reporting about the delivery of certain supplies. He ends the call, but not until telling the person on the other line that he would call once again when he locks on his target.

In the school's courtyard, Mikoto finds herself struggling to interact with Febrie, who impatiently waits for Saten to return. As Mikoto ponders on her next move, Febrie impulsively follows someone wearing a Gekota suit, only to be shocked to find out that inside is a lolicon with blue hair and piercings. She soon roams around the school premises, seemingly disappointed about her meeting with the "guy in a Gekota costume", but soon finds out that her pink Gekota toy is missing. At that moment, the fact that she is lost dawns on Febrie.

Mikoto frantically searches the school perimeter in search for Febrie while holding the Gekota toy she dropped. After quickly calling her friends, they begin a tight search on their missing friend. Fortunately, she and Kongou manage to find Febrie... only to discover that there are three security robots that are speeding towards her. Mikoto quickly calls Febrie's name before leaping to her position, using her ability to hurl the robots away from Febrie.

The Railgun is relieved that Febrie, despite constantly ignoring her, is safe in the arms of Saten, who arrived shortly with Uiharu and Kuroko. Meanwhile, one more person who has shown his interest over Febrie has reported about the sighting through phone.

After what happened earlier, Mikoto apologizes to Saten for almost losing Febrie, but Saten also says sorry for being part of the mess that had happened. Saten then asks Febrie to say sorry for worrying Mikoto a lot. Febrie goes to hug Mikoto, but she actually snatches Mikoto's pink Gekota once again. This time, however, she actually thanks Mikoto for the "gift". Although shocked by Febrie's quick move, Mikoto shows a smile of relief before deciding to start a game of tag with Febrie.

Saten, Uiharu and Kuroko seem relieved that Mikoto has finally become friends with Febrie, while Kongou's "contributions" end up being treated as a joke by Kuroko, much to Kongou's frustration.

Elsewhere, the events that unfolded was discussed by five mysterious figures, who have commented that the opportunity to perform experiments on not only the ranked-fourth Level 5 but the ranked-third as well is—in a twisted irony—a godsend for them. Once more, a votation is opened, revealing yet another unanimous vote... this time, towards the experimentation of the Railgun, Misaka Mikoto!

Shunichi makes a vote for the next experiment.

content.Biography--Plot:
Shampoo is defeated by Ranma, sparking her thirst for revenge.

Soon after getting cursed at Jusenkyo , Ranma (as a girl) and Genma (as a panda) dropped into a contest in a village of the Joketsuzoku "tribe of women heroes" ("Chinese Amazons" in English versions). Half-starved, they fed on the next available food-stuff - the feast that was to be the first prize for the contest - and were instantly challenged by Shampoo, the village champion. Ranma swiftly defeated her, but this was a bad move. According to Chinese Amazon tribal laws, if a female Amazon is defeated by a female outsider, she must give the outsider the "Kiss of Death", hunt her down to the ends of the Earth, and kill her (as Ranma tells Akane, "and when they say 'to the ends of Earth', they mean it" ). Ranma and Genma managed to elude Shampoo and settled down in Nerima, thinking that they have lost her.

However, Shampoo eventually tracked female Ranma down and resumed her attempts at murder. She found Ranma, this time a male, in the Tendo household—where she managed to enter courtesy of Kasumi Tendo , who thought Genma had invited her, when she was actually stalking him—and declares her intent to kill Akane for hiding female Ranma from her. Ranma stopped Shampoo attack by kicking the head off of her chuí, which knocked her cold when it landed on her head, accidentally defeating her a second time. However, instead of receiving a "Kiss of Death," Ranma got a kiss on the lips; it turns out that if a female Amazon is defeated by a male outsider, she has to marry him. Shampoo continues on the path of trying to marry male Ranma and kill female Ranma, until Ranma tricked her into thinking that the male side is a disguise for the female side, causing her to run away heartbroken and sobbing.

Heartbroken, Shampoo returned to China, where she underwent re-training at the hands of her great-grandmother Cologne and accidently received a cat curse at Jusenkyo . Realizing that Ranma had been cursed as well, Shampoo went back to Japan with Cologne to try to marry Ranma once more, learning in the process that he is actually male. Unfortunately, this revelation came at a price: Ranma has been completely "phobic" about cats (ailurophobic) since childhood. Nevertheless, Shampoo decided to remain near Ranma and, with her great-grandmother's help, opened the Cat Café in Furinkan .

Besides Akane and Ukyo, Shampoo has managed to gain at least two strong rivals in the herbalists Pink and Link , a pair of twin sisters who live in Yakusai , a village near Joketsuzoku. The twins and Shampoo have held a grudge against each other since they were very little girls, and there is no sign of it ending anytime soon. In their latest attempt at getting back at Shampoo, Pink and Link declared to Joketsuzoku’s local newspaper that Shampoo’s husband Ranma was ugly and weak; Shampoo had previously lied to the newspaper, stating that she was already married and living with Ranma.

Even if she has been chased by the Ghost Cat Maomolin a couple of times, Shampoo really has only one strong suitor, her childhood friend Mousse , whom she rejected since they were both three. Cologne has stated that this holds true by Amazon law, regardless if he manages to beat Ranma, but Mousee remains stubborn despite Shampoo's multiple rejections and usual mistreatment. In Shampoo's defense, Mousse is very clingy, often trying to glomp her and will not take no for an answer. Then again, she behaves exactly the same way towards Ranma, to an even more severe degree, and has been repeatedly shown as far more inconsiderate towards him than Mousse is to her. As is standard for the series, either behavior is frequently used in a comical yet not-so-subtle-critical manner. Regardless, she occasionally shows some concern when he drives himself too far.
content.Appearance:
Shampoo's battle outfit.

Shampoo has dark pink eyes and knee-length dark hair (blue/purple in the anime) with a fringe and two strands hanging in front that are secured with yellow ties. In the remake version, her pink eyes are no longer darkened and her hair is now bright purple with a white shine.

Shampoo in her cursed form

Shampoo often dresses in various forms of Chinese clothing, usually a matching blouse and pants, over which she may wear an apron while working. Her combat outfit consists of a light colored long-sleeved blouse and pants with the addition of a dark breastplate and a pair of metal arm-guards, making her one of the few characters to wear any form of armor. For formal occasions. she favors sleeveless cheongsam .

Shampoo's cat form is light colored with dark ears and paws, a characteristic fringe, and similar strands that frame its face. In the original anime, it has light pink fur with darker pink paws and ears.

Several characters like Ranma and the Jusenkyo Guide has commented that Shampoo is cute. During the Phoenix Pill arc, a date with her as the prize was enough to motivate dozens of onlookers to participate in the Snowman Race. Her cat form is also considered adorable by Kasumi.
content.Personality:
Shampoo joyfully resting in her two forms.

Shampoo is extremely manipulative, devious, strategic scheming, [ citation needed ] play-acting [ citation needed ] and completely ruthless behavior to advance her position towards the object of her attention. Like her great-grandmother Colgone, Shampoo does seem to enjoy having fun from the trouble she causes, particularly if it means she can get close to Ranma as a result.

Given Shampoo's violent behaviour, she views anyone who attempts to get between her and Ranma as an "obstacle" which must be killed. However, she has also resorted to non-lethal methods to remove an "obstacle", such as when she used the "Xi Fa Xiang Gao" to wipe Akane's memories of Ranma; until they return at which time she decides to resort to her usual violent techniques. With Shampoo's knowledge of pressure points and moxibustion , she is open to the idea of manipulating other's will to her advantage, whether that be to eliminate Akane or increasing the likelihood of Ranma returning her feelings for him.

Shampoo shows elements of the tsundere character, given her initially hostile temperament towards Ranma before slowly becoming more attracted to him until she finally stops her plans for revenge in favor of ensuring her marriage to Ranma. Of all the fiancées, Shampoo is the most sexually uninhibited, possibly due to her upbringing in a society including extensive warrior training for both males and females. Nudity is not a problem for her, as she rather enjoys being naked and has attempted to seduce Ranma many times, even in dangerous places like under a giant bell. Early in the series, Kasumi had a talk with her about modesty. Although Shampoo did cease her faint-inducing habit of popping out of the tub naked anytime Ranma tried to take a bath, the conversation has apparently had little effect on her behavior other than that.
content.Abilities:
Having been trained in the martial art techniques of the Joketsuzoku since birth, with Cologne as her personal instructor and the young female village champion (probably making her the strongest member in her village after Cologne), Shampoo is an excellent armed or unarmed fighter, is very swift and acrobatic, and strong enough to casually walk right through reinforced stone walls on a regular basis. She uses a pair of chuí as her primary weapons, but is also shown using other weapons. These include a dao, spear, a bow, and a variety of polearms, including a Monk's Spade.

Shampoo's greatest strength may lie in sheer versatility. Beyond her fighting abilities, she has displayed knowledge of ventriloquism/voice imitation, shiatsu-induced unconsciousness, mind-control, memory loss, sleep-fighting, intuitive multi-step strategy, defense against enchanted herbs, Chinese cooking, and incredible tracking skills enabling her to hunt Ranma from rural China to the east of Japan. She even has access to minor magic equipment - the Instant Jusenkyo , the Love Pill Bracelet , the Waterproof Soap , the Kairaishi Mushroom and the Reversal Jewel being major examples - and is capable of using her bike to literally bounce across the city.

Shampoo is noted to be a competent fighter by many other characters, and has joined Ranma against many opponents such as Taro and the Phoenix tribe . Shampoo's most impressive moment in the manga came when she was freed from Kiema 's enslavement, and was intent to let her captor "suffer a thousand deaths". She managed to hold her own against the Phoenix tribe captain, although, in the one full page dedicated to their battle, Kiima was shown as mostly interested in freeing the Kinjakan to assist her lord Saffron in his confrontation with Ranma. They are later shown as completely focused on watching the fight, with Kiima caught in Shampoo's headlock. In the anime, a similar fight occurred with Mon Lon in the movie " Big Trouble in Nekonron, China "; shortly afterwards Mon Lon was incapacitated in the arms of Mousse, who believed her to be Shampoo, while Shampoo is shown to be okay.

In the Shonen Sunday Wide-ban edition of the manga, Shampoo's end-of-series stats are shown to be lower than Ranma, comparable to Ryoga, and above Mousse, Ukyo, Akane and Kodachi. Her top stats are heart and technique, and she has shown being faster than Mousse. It can be difficult to compare her with Tatewaki Kuno , as the latter can either pose a challenge for Ranma, with powerful air-pressure swipes, be treated as a 1-hit joke, an even match for his sister Kodachi , or even as vastly superior to his nemesis.

Shampoo has scared Ranma while she was still attempting to kill him in her female form. However, Shampoo is still outclassed by Ranma however, and was swiftly overpowered the first few times she has seriously faced him in combat. She suffered a 1-hit loss during her village's martial arts competition, where the goal was to knock the opponent off the log they were standing on, and an accidental identical result when focused on killing Akane, both times before she was powered-up by Cologne. After Ranma lied to Shampoo that she was a girl all along, Shampoo made a strike at female Ranma, but his hand was positioned to block it, and Shampoo stopped herself before delivering it. In the original anime continuity Shampoo actually seemed to overpower female Ranma, attacking more aggressively using her chuí, and he tripped while dodging her attacks and was left on the ground seemingly helpless. Fortunately, Shampoo was unwilling to land the blow and stopped her attack. During the "Reversal Jewel" arc, Shampoo was again outmatched by female Ranma in unarmed combat, despite his holding back by only using restraining tactics, and her cursed 'programming' to truly hate him. It is noteworthy that Shampoo did manage better against Ranma when armed with her signature weapons in the final arc, but female Ranma also held back by sticking to defensive/restraining regular fighting, due to Shampoo being brainwashed. We don't even see them fight one on one for very long, as Mousse in duck form ambushed Shampoo with weapons, and she eventually used an imprinting egg on Genma after recovering.

Notably, Mousse has displayed vastly superior mettle in several of his battles with Ranma, although this has gained him very limited respect. Though mettle in part could be a factor, it is likely that Shampoo was simply less durable than Mousse earlier on, akin to a glass cannon (albeit still more resilient than Akane at the start of the series), rather than being weaker than Mousee in general. The Shonen Sunday Wide-ban edition of the manga shows Shampoo noticeably higher in the listed categories Mousse isn't almost at or equal in.

The main constant rival of Shampoo is Akane, the only fiancé of Ranma he accepted. Shampoo has been explicitly shown as stronger and faster than Akane early in the series. During their first duel, Shampoo effortlessly dodged Akane's kick and knocked her out with the Hissatsu Shiatsuken. Later on, Shampoo managed to stand up to Akane's strength to an extent even after she had eaten Super Soba , despite not being aware of this fact. When Shampoo ate some Super Soba of her own, the two seemed more evenly matched, but Shampoo did not have much time to challenge Akane in either case before Ranma tricked her into eating the antidote. In the early manga, at the start of the Martial Arts Takeout race, Shampoo casually deflected a flurry of daggers thrown at Akane's back while she was serving customers by flinging the bowl of ramen straight into the air and using her serving tray to reflect the daggers back and pin the customers that Cologne was trying to impress to the wall without hurting them. Shampoo did this feat without looking back or moving anything other than her arms, caught the thrown bowl of ramen without spilling a drop, and was neither surprised nor strained by this exertion. By comparison, Akane would not receive a similar feat - deflecting and/or dodging a barrage of arrows fired from the front - until the second-last story of the manga.

Shampoo's only shown skirmish with her other rival Ukyo (beyond a couple of brief, or off-screen free-for-all gang-ups against Ranma, Hinako, or Genma) happened during the onsen race, and consisted of Shampoo being kept busy deflecting Ukyo mini-spatulas, while their feet were tied to Ranma and Ryoga's respectively, but Ukyo didn't use her more powerful special techniques, and also managed to hold her own against Ranma for a much longer time during their initial conflict. Ukyo's better performance is at least partially due to being surrounded by a hot grill and that Ranma initially held back, but she also managed to avoid two of his attacks and strike him with a flour bomb when this was no longer the case, as well as fight and parry with Ryoga for a brief time before being overcome. In the end there has been no clear-cut contest of relative skill between the two in the manga. In the anime continuity their comparative ability is more clearly displayed. In "Ranma the Lady-Killer" they are both exhausted after a duel that has gone on for hours. Shampoo was not shown using her chuí, and Ukyo not shown employing her superior range of special techniques. While Ukyo is distracted by talking to Ranma just as the fight resumes, Shampoo uses the moment to sucker-attack Ukyo with a barrage of thrown forks, pinning her to a tree.

In the arc with Pink and Link, despite letting her guard down a few times and landing herself in trouble, when Shampoo is focused on the pair she makes a much quicker work of them than Ranma. This results in Pink and Link being genuinely terrified of her, but relatively indifferent to Ranma to the point of not respecting him as a figher. WIth Pink and Link, Shampoo seems to take a similar brute force approach she took on earlier with Ranma, suggesting that part of her issues with fighting her beloved Ranma may be in approach just like Ranma is hesitant to fight against Akane due to his romantic feelings for the only fiancé he acknowledged, though he still seems a superior fighter than Shampoo overall. Interestingly, Shampoo seems to be a much more brutal fighter while unconcious and unable to hold back, implying she tends to not go all out in a typical fight.
content.Abilities--Techniques--Combat-oritented:
[ -Hissatsu Shiatsuken
(必殺指圧拳 ,  Xi Fa Xiang Gao
? ) : An attack using a specially devised herbal shampoo in conjunction with a shiatsu massage technique involving pressure points on the head to erase her opponent's memories. The process takes at most 6 seconds.
-Remote Control Acupressure
: Activated by pressing both fingers against an unprepared target's temples. Afterwards the victim is susceptible to a brief mind-control effect. Used to turn a distracted Akane unconscious during the 'waterproof soap' story, when Shampoo made Akane put herself in harm's way by standing in front of a roller coaster, then affectionately hug Ryoga and finally urge him to give back Shampoo the waterproof soap.
-Sleep fighting
: Used against Pink and Link after being bitten by the Poisonous-Snake Plant. Although someone bitten by the plan will fall into a deep sleep which needs an antidote to awaken from, Shampoo's hatred of the twins was so strong that she nearly killed the two even while asleep before eventually succumbing to the plant's poison.
-Kakato Otoshi:
 A jumps on someone's head to get a boost, used on Akane
. Named in Ranma 1/2: Hard Battle
.
-Dumpling
 Bombs
: Similar to Ukyo's okonomiyaki
 bombs, but smaller. Only used in the final wedding story.
-Fork Darts
 (Anime): Similar to Ukyo's spatula shuriken. ]
content.Abilities--Techniques--Less combat-orien:
[ -Voice Imitation
: Another 'secret soap' technique. Shampoo perfectly imitated Akane's tone of voice, but it is unclear if she used ventriloquism or not given that she crouched behind her rival.
-Chow Mein Strike
: The user turns a bowl-full of ramen noodles into a whip, forcing the intended food recipient to eat his way out during take-out competitions. Given its limited tensile strength it's likely not useful beyond this function.
-Delivery Box Blow-out
 (also known as the Box-Blower Blow): A move from the school of 'Martial Arts Takeout,' a style in which Cologne has stated that Shampoo is 'not half bad.' This allows the user to instantly 'overcook' the food contained within a delivery box with a finger or pointed hand strike. It may have had a similar effect when Shampoo accidentally struck a water tower instead, although more likely it simply burst after being slightly cracked. This technique only appears in Shampoo's arsenal in the manga; in the anime it is the property of Kaori Daikoku
. ]
content.Relationships--Family:
Cologne

Cologne talks to Shampoo

Shampoo and her great-grandmother Cologne have a very close familiar relationship. Cologne has raised and trained Shampoo from a young age, and is openly proud of her martial arts student and great-grandaughter. While Cologne made severe mistakes towards Shampoo like choosing Jusenkyo as a training spot, they usually get along rather well, to the point that Cologne followed Shampoo to Japan in hopes of the younger woman marrying Ranma. Upon their arrival, Cologne not only opened a restaurant to ensure their joint livehood, but also supported the schemes of her great-grandaugher and tested the skills of her "son-in-law". Both Cologne and Shampoo have similar personality traits, most notably their enjoyment for the chaos their presence brings, for better and worse.
content.Relationships--Romances:
Mousse

Main article: Mousse-Shampoo Relationship

Mousse and Shampoo hanging out

Possibly Shampoo's most prominent relationship besides her familiar bond with Cologne, Shampoo and Mousse have been childhood friends. Shampoo generally acts rather cold towards Mousse, but does have her moments where she is nice to him. Mousse, on the other hand. is in love with Shampoo and desperately seeks her attention, despite her being after Ranma.

Shampoo's desire for a man who can sweep her off her feet suggests that she might downplay her own strength either subconsciously or intentionally, perhaps to indulge in the fantasy of being rescued. This inclination is evident in her attempt to coerce Pink and Link into creating a scenario for Ranma to come to her rescue, though the outcome is far from successful. Furthermore, her apparent disinterest in Mousse may not solely be attributed to his submissiveness or underhandedness but could also stem from his inability to fully match her combat abilities.

Early in the manga, Shampoo sabotaged Mousse's romantic efforts many times and stated outright that she hates Mousse , claiming in the closing chapter that he makes her sick, and that that she would like to personally kill him for his "foolish behavior" and "ruining her happiness". However, there have been a few hints that her feelings for her childhood 'friend' are not restricted to contempt, loathing and annoyance. Nevertheless, it always takes extreme circumstances for her to give him any leeway whatsoever since she generally harshly rejects, and treats him in a very cold manner. For example, she cheerfully repeatedly threw bombs at him (which are non lethal by Ranmaverse standards) during a duel with Ranma, since she didn't wish to give him a promised date if he either managed to prevail, or Ranma lost on purpose. While she temporarily felt bad about it and cradled his beaten duck form afterward, she quickly got over it, tying him with a chain to the neck, and taunted him by holding his food out of reach. When she found his duck form beaten (by Taro) on the street, she didn't bother to brake and casually ran over him, but seemed somewhat concerned or at least curious afterwords. After Ranma pinned Mousse's duck form to a wall and said 'If you weren't such a moron I wouldn't have Shampoo pestering me all the time,' she did turn into a cat and began to chase Ranma, but not to save Mousse, but because she was maddened by the statement. She didn't care when he was to leave for China at first, but she was glad when he returned and even had a feast prepared for him. (though these actions are possibly cause her and Cologne needed to go away for a while and have someone watch the restaurant.)

By the later part of the manga, there are hints Shampoo may be softening her stance towards Mousse.  When love has been turned to hate by the Reverse Jewel, Mousse decided to take advantage to approach an affected Shampoo, who rejected and beat him in the normal manner, which may hint that her feelings towards him contain elements of both derision and appreciation. Cologne even commented that "It seems as if Shampoo does not hate you as much as before". She later agreed to go on a date with Mousse after he eventually abstained from using magic apology-inducing glasses during his duels with Ranma, while the other man retaliated by using any petty cheats available. Unfortunately for Mousse, the goodwill he earned by appearing in a better light than his rival was eradicated when he took Shampoo to a zombie-demon show, which she found disgusting and not romantic in the least. Later, when Mousse was almost drained of life while enchanted into dating a magic Jizo statue he believed was Shampoo, she initially didn't care at all and stayed home to play video games instead. Eventually, she reluctantly gave him a scarf she was making for Ranma to wake him from the trance. After Mousse decided to free Shampoo from Kiima's slavery instead of taking advantage, she didn't feel the least inclination of gratitude, or even spared him a moment's thought, but rather immediately took the opportunity to hug Ranma instead. That said, she shouldn't feel in debt for not being enslaved by him, though. And a few chapters later anyway, when Mousse pointed out that his heart has been true to HER all this time and there's nothing more she can do about Ranma since he is marrying Akane soon, Shampoo begrudgingly agreed with him and then asked Mousse to make celebratory meat buns with her for Ranma's and Akane's wedding. However, she soon succumbed to her old habit of trying to break Ranma and Akane up again

In the separate anime continuity there are occasional hints that Shampoo actually does hold some love for Mousee, despite vehemently professing the contrary. In the later part of the series Shampoo was the one who convinced him to stay in Japan rather than go back to China, and she cradled him in her arms when he saved her life but was almost killed in the 'Nihao, My Concubine' movie. In the first example, though, she and Cologne explicitly did so because they decided to go to a hot springs and wanted somebody to watch the shop, and knew that Mousse was still available and would do it for free. In the second example, Shampoo is shown relaxing while Mousse is being forced to do heavy labor in the background in the ending credits.

Ranma Saotome

Main article: Ranma-Shampoo Relationship

Shampoo being smitten with Ranma.

Because of her traditions and Ranma defeating her (accidentally) in his male form, it is law that she marry him, and she tries everything possible to accomplish that. Frequently, she glomps Ranma on sight and asks for a date, much to his chagrin. She is not above using trickery and magic to get Ranma to fall in love with her. When Ranma was first hugged by Shampoo, he blushed and thought to himself that she was cute. He seems to have a good degree of friendship with her, going to the Cat Cafe for free bowls of ramen and helping Mousse to rescue her when she's held captive by Maomolin. However, unlike Ukyo, who Ranma at least considers as a regular, non-romantic old friend, he has stated outright that he views Shampoo. Regardless, his attitude towards both of them seems conflicted between consideration for their feelings. He was moved by Shampoo's tears when she believed that he rejected her during the onsen race, and had a similar problem with Ukyo during the 'Secret Sauce' arc. His pride took it as a direct challenge to win back Shampoo's affections during the 'Reversal Jewel' storyline, where he also forces a confession out of Ukyo to feel desirable again. His only attempt to directly get rid of Shampoo (beyond encouraging Mousse in his efforts) happened during her first appearance. Ranma is also noticably put off by Mousse considering using the imprinting eggs to make Shampoo his girlfriend as shown in Chapter 398 , but that might out of empathy since Ranma has experienced harassment by men in his female form quite often. Like most cute girls in the series, she can usually manipulate him by feigning tears. If that fails, Shampoo can sometimes get Ranma to bend to her will by transforming into her cat form and taking advantage of his fear -  she usually performs this stunt when he makes her angry.
content.Relationships--Friendships:
Akane Tendo

Shampoo first saw Akane as an obstacle for Ranma's affection, and has tried to kill or do away with her on more then one occasion, but after relocating permanently to Furinkan, changes her view on Akane. In a sense, they have a similar relationship to Ranma's and Ryoga's, being fierce rivals and battling on occasion, yet considering each other close friends, and saving each other on a basis, such as when Akane helped Mousse and Ranma free Shampoo from Maomolin, or when Shampoo helped to rescue Akane when she was kidnapped by Kirin of the Seven Lucky Gods. This doesn't stop Akane from being irritated when Shampoo tackle glomps Ranma, nor does it stop Shampoo in the pursuit of her airen.

Ukyo Kuonji

Shampoo and Ukyo have a complex relationship. While the two are rivals for Ranma's affections, and rivals in the food business, they can occasionally get along. Other times, they usually trade snide remarks. Their rivalry can be displayed not just in their fighting but in their cooking, when Ukyo accidentally ruined Shampoo's ramen by getting okonomiyaki sauce in it, but only sarcastically apologized, which led to Shampoo pouring it onto Ukyo's cooking.

Ryoga Hibiki

Shampoo initially did not acknowledge Ryoga as anyone significant, as at the time, she was hellbent on killing Ranma's female side. Ryoga didn't seem to think much of her either initially. He soon came to fear her after she attempted to serve him (in his pig form) as a dish to Ranma and kicked him in the head during her fight with Akane. Of course, Shampoo didn't know of his Jusenkyo curse at the time. After her relocation, she tends to hang out with Ryoga (along with Mousse, Ranma, and the others) and is shown to have a degree of friendship. This didn't stop her from trying to steal back her waterproof soap when it ended up in his hands.
content.Non-canon appearances: Shampoo has been a staple character in the most of the video games and a playable character in the fighting games. She  made several cameos in Kappa Mikey in crowd scenes, usually dancing, and also appears briefly in the opening theme.
content.Trivia:
Mimi and Nene.

[ -As with her fellow Joketsuzoku
, Cologne
 and Mousse
, the gag in Shampoo's name is that the romanization of her name - Shān Pú
 or Shānpú
 - sounds like a beauty product in English. Uniquely amongst the Joketsuzoku, Shampoo's name can be written with either of two pairings of kanji/hanzi that share the same pronunciation. The first set of kanji/hanzi that can be used to write Shān Pú
 are the characters for "Coral" (Shān
) and "Uncut Gem" (Pú
). The second set uses the characters "Mountain(-like)" (Shān
) and "Chest" (Pú
).
-Shampoo's hair color in the anime adaptation can vary depending on episode. The vast majority of her episodes depict her with dark blue hair, but the OAVs and Movies, as well as certain episodes, show her with dark purple hair. Oddly, Shampoo is depicted with green hair in the first opening of the series.
-Fans of the series often mistakenly refer to Shampoo's weapons as bonbori
, which is incorrect: bonbori are a spherical shaped paper lantern that are hung outside in Japan, which her weapons do resemble. The english manual for Ranma ½: Hard Battle
 mistakenly refers to them as "lanterns." Her weapons are actually a pair of chuí
. Chuí are maces with a large spherical head made out of solid iron or bronze, as such they are extremely heavy and cannot be used by most people.
-A fundamental quirk of Shampoo's character is that she does not have a native speaker's affinity for Japanese, and how this is portrayed varies depending on the language into which the series has been dubbed. In the original Japanese, and in its Chinese translation, Shampoo speaks in an archaically formal manner. In the English, she uses a form of "broken English", referring to herself in the third person and utilizing a minimalistic dialogue that emphasizes nouns and verbs whilst omitting prepositions, indefinite articles and definite articles.
-The manga has a running gag of Shampoo making her entrance by running over people, mainly Ranma, with her bicycle. This also appears on a few occasions in the anime, but is usually directed against other people and only appears roughly half a dozen times in all of the anime episodes and specials.
-Shampoo's mother is never shown during the series. Her father appears several times in cameos in the manga but never in the anime.
-Shampoo's seiyū provided the voice of Masato's Mother
 of the Rumiko Takahashi Theater: Mermaid's Forest
.
-Shampoo's English voice actress would provide the voices of the Mama Higurashi
 and Urasue
 on Inuyasha
.
-Shampoo seems to have been designed as a reference to the female protagonist Lum
 from Takahashi's earlier comedy series Urusei Yatsura
. Both characters are exotic "foreigner" girls characterized as being highly loving and affectionate, but also temperamental, violent, scheming and jealously possessive, with an imperfect understanding of proper Japanese behaviors.
-Shampoo seems to be the inspiration for several female characters who have appeared in other anime.
 [ -One episode of Slayers NEXT
 features the traveling twin martial artists Mimi and Nene
, aspiring idol singers whom Lina encounters during a search for a magical ritual whose origins she has misunderstood. The twins are clearly based on Shampoo in terms of their designs, sharing her odango hairstyle, wearing qipao, and having purple colored hair similar to Shampoo, as well as having her affinity for martial arts in a series where swordplay and sorcery are the normal means of combat.
-Renka Ma
 from History's Strongest Disciple Kenichi
 is another apparent homage to Shampoo; like Shampoo, she is a very beautiful female martial artist from China with exotic purple hair and superhuman physical abilities who acts as a rival to the female protagonist Miu Fūrinji
 for the love of the male protagonist, Kenichi Shirahama
. Renka's tendency to act with feline mannerisms, and her cat-themed hairstyle, acts as an homage to Shampoo's transforming into a cat due to her Jusenkyo
 curse. ]
-Her English Voice Actress in the 2024 series Grace Lu Mentioned on Instagram her love the of the 1989 series ]

content.Charactah Account:
Hinata Hoshino is the progeny of Chizuru Hoshino and maintains a familial bond with her elder sister, Miyako Hoshino. Within her social sphere, she also shares a camaraderie with Hana Shirosaki and Noa Himesaka.

Hinata is characterized by her vibrant and spirited demeanor. She exhibits a strong affection for Miyako, addressing her as "Mya-nee." Occasionally, she experiences feelings of envy when Miyako engages in endeavors with their mutual acquaintance, Hana Shirosaki.

content.Trivia:
[ -The natal date of Hinata is the 10th of May, which corresponds to the astrological sign of Taurus.
-Among her preferences, Hinata holds a particular affection for Miyako and does not exhibit any dislikes.
-Noa Himesaka, a character of significance, resides in close proximity to Hinata as her neighbor.
-It is Hinata's aspiration to assume a caretaking role for Miyako in the future as she matures.
-Not only does Hinata possess a vibrant energy, she also excels in the realm of athletics.
-A notable incident involved Hana and Noa attempting to deplete her vitality through a running exercise, which instead led to their own fatigue while she remained energetic.
-Among her physical capabilities, Hinata is adept at performing a backflip.
-The origins of Hinata's moniker for her elder sister, "Mya-nee," are intriguing, not being a simple contraction of "Miyako-onee." Initially, "Mya" may have originated from early baby talk or an attempt to pronounce "mama." When Miyako corrected her to denote the sisterly relationship, the term evolved into "Mya-nee."
-Rika Nagae, the voice artist for the character of Hinata, acknowledged the character's birthday in the year 2020 through a social media platform, Twitter.
-In light of an oversight from the previous year, Hinata is diligently striving to ensure she does not forget Miyako's birthday again. ]

content.Appearance:
Yoo Joonghyuk is repeatedly described as extremely handsome by various individuals, including the author of Ways of Survival and Kim Dokja . The latter even uses him as a measurement for others' handsomeness on multiple occasions.

Yoo Joonghyuk has wide black eyes with thin double eyelids and thick eyebrows. His right eye glows golden upon activation of the skill [Sage's Eye]. His hair is black and slightly wavy, cut short. He has tan skin, a sharp nose ridge, and a strong jawline. He is extremely muscular; in particular, he has well-toned biceps and thighs.

Yoo Joonghyuk usually wears a black coat and combat boots. Under the jacket, covers for the novel have shown him to wear a black shirt with a silver collar and buckle, along with close-fitting black pants. He is also depicted as having at least one belt across his chest, along with a sword scabbard worn at his waist, held on by straps attached to his belt and around his thigh.

In his female form, under the pseudonym "Punisher", Yoo Joonghyuk has waist-length hair and deep, sultry eyes beneath neat eyebrows. He is, according to Kim Dokja, thrice as beautiful in his Punisher form than his male form. He is smaller and sleeker than usual in this form, and wears a black cape to cover hide his distinctive clothing.

When acting as Zhu Bajie during the reenactment of Journey to the West, he wears a half-open black vest and tight black jeans.
content.Personality:
Yoo Joonghyuk was designed as someone 'tougher in body and nobler in heart than any creature in this world'. He is resolute and determined, aiming to accomplish his goals no matter the cost, in particular when aiming for the end of the scenarios. As a protagonist, Yoo Joonghyuk naturally fights for the greater good. He was originally a caring person at heart, doing good where he could, but repeated regressions have worn him down to the point where, in his 1863 rd round, he commits enough sins to make him a prime target of the Absolute Good constellations.

Yoo Joonghyuk is normally very confident in his abilities, never backing down from a challenge and typically cutting down his enemies with ease. He is extremely talented in various areas, befitting of his status as a protagonist. He takes pride in his own skill, sometimes to the point of not perceiving anyone else's work as good, as seen when he will eat no one's cooking but his own. Yoo Joonghyuk is smart and strategic; this helps him learn new skills and figure out plans to subvert the scenarios. However, he can also struggle to adapt his strategies and see things from new perspectives. This is a major reason as to why he took 1863 rounds to even get close to the Final Wall; he would struggle to change his strategies and adapt to new situations, easily failing and having to regress.

Yoo Joonghyuk's speech is concise and blunt, often to the point of rudeness. He becomes explicitly rude and threatening when speaking to individuals who irritate him, or who are powerful unknowns. He is sometimes also rude to his own party members, though he looks out for them nonetheless, showing that he cares despite his harshness. Frequently, he expresses himself through actions or expressions rather than words. These include habits such as dragging the tip of his sword along the ground when happy, or his left eyebrow twitching upon making an serious decision. On rare occasions, however, he can be very eloquent and persuasive.

Over the course of his regressions, aside from becoming more open to cruelty, he becomes extremely calculating and cold. He kills those he deems threats and supports those who he believes can aid him. He distances himself even from his own companions; in the 41 st round, when his core party members die, he only laments that they are no longer useful. However, this is most likely a tactic to try and minimize the hurt of losing them, as even further regressions show him warming back up to them, selflessly sacrificing himself for them over and over; which is most evidently referenced and shown in his 999th regression.

The trauma he experiences over his regressions result in Yoo Joonghyuk having a tendency to fall into "regression depression", where he easily loses hope on even small failures, and considers giving up and regressing so that he can try again next round. The further into his regressions he is, the stronger the effect of regression depression, until in his 1863 rd round, it causes him to fall into a dissociative state where he is completely unresponsive.

content.Trivia:
[ -Kim Dokja often refers to Yoo Joonghyuk as a sunfish. This is a reference to the game "Survive! Mola Mola" (mola mola is another name for a sunfish). In the game, you have to keep a sunfish alive and escape the dangers of the sea. However, the sunfish dies because of almost anything and one must start over many times in order to get anywhere; this parallels how Yoo Joonghyuk needed over a thousand rounds in order to even approach a conclusive end to the scenarios, and how he died very easily particularly in the early rounds.
-He dislikes the color white.
-Taking the year that ORV started (2018) to be the same calendar year in-text at the start of the novel, and assuming that all ages are given according to the Korean system, Yoo Joonghyuk's date of birth is August 3, 1991.
-His favorite food is murim dumplings.
-His eyesight is the best out of every member of Kim Dokja's Company.
-Yoo Joongyuk is not bad at singing, but he is tone deaf and doesn't realize it.
-Due to coming into existence as an adult, Yoo Joonghyuk never attended high school, however, if he ever were a high school student he would be uninterested in studying but attend classes faithfully. He would like playing games after school and often get confessed to by female students because of his good looks, however he would not be interested in dating.
-After the group regression came back, Yoo Joonghyuk tried to get back into pro-gaming but ended up quitting.
-If the events of ORV never happened and Yoo Joonghyuk retired from pro-gaming, he would have went on to become an actor or model. He might have also become the lead actor in a movie adaptation of one of Han Sooyoung's novels.
-Due to his lack of childhood memories, Yoo Joonghyuk did not know his birthday. Namgung Minyoung was the one to give him the date August 3rd.
-Yoo Joonghyuk is represented as wolf multiple times throughout the story and it is his official animal counterpart. Several merch pieces in the Taiwanese version feature him with wolf ears and tail. ]
content.Trivia--Translation:
[ -Yoo Joonghyuk's name has been a source of some contention.
 [ -The hangul is most directly transliterated as "Yoo Joonghyeok". The "oo" in Yoo
 and Joo
nghyuk are functionally the same sound, which is why the spelling Yoo Joonghyuk is the one favored on this wiki. The "eo" sound is also often transliterated as "u" in English, hence the change from Joonghyeo
k to Joonghyu
k. This "eo" → "u" change can also be seen in other names, such as Lee Hyu
nsu
ng's and Ju
ng Heewon's.
-However, the first translator
 used to spell it Yoo Jonghyuk (with only one O in his given name). They have since stated that this was an error, and if possible they'd want to change it.
-The second translator
 changed it to the more accurate Yu Jung-Hyeok, but did not use the "eo" → "u" method, using "oo" → "u" instead and leaving "eo" as is. This was done to keep to the Revised Romanization
 standards, the current official romanization system in South Korea.
-The spelling used in official English translations is Yu Junghyeok/Junghyeok Yu. ] ]
